body.p: The Board observed from its discussions with field visit participants that much of the confusion stemmed from the definition of a ‘cash‑generating unit’, when coupled with the proposal in paragraph 73 of the Exposure Draft for goodwill to be allocated to each ‘smallest cash‑generating unit to which a portion of the carrying amount of the goodwill can be allocated on a reasonable and consistent basis’. Additionally, field visit participants and respondents were unclear about the reference in paragraph 74 of the Exposure Draft to ‘the lowest level at which management monitors the return on investments in assets that include goodwill’, the most frequent question being ‘what level of management?’ (eg board of directors, chief executive officer, or segment management).
